text:
Here are the best ways you
can get in contact with Amazon

if you have a problem with
an order or your account.

Use the clickable sections
below to skip to each method.
You can contact Amazon's customer service
through these phone numbers.
These numbers are live 24 hours a day,
seven days a week.

Another way to get in
contact with customer service
through a phone call
would be to use the call me now feature.
To do this, go to Amazon.com.
Click on the customer service option
from the list at the top of the page.
Scroll down under "Browse Help Topics"

and move your cursor
over "Need More Help?"
Then click "Contact Us."
Under "Start chatting now,"
you will see a "We can call you" option.

Select the category that
is related to your issue.
Then follow the rest of the prompts
and choose "Call me now."
To use the chat function for help,

go back to the customer
service contact us page.
Click on the "Start chatting now" option

to be connected with
a messaging assistant.
The bot will ask you a few questions
to figure out what the issue is.

If the problem is beyond
the bot's abilities,
you will be connected with a real person
who will assist you instead.
For issues with your account,
such as a billing dispute,
you can email cis@amazon.com.
For general inquiries,
you can email primary@amazon.com.
